title: University Open Air
description: Immigrant teachers, professors, and academics who were trained outside of the U.S. share their knowledge with the public at a series of outdoor free classes held on the grounds around the Prospect Park Boathouse.

title: Imagine This Women’s Film Festival
description: The ninth annual Imagine This Women’s Film Festival celebrates the work of women, BIPOC, LGBTQIA+, and underrepresented filmmakers from around the world, with over 90 films and screenplays from 20+ countries.
address: Look Cinemas (Hell’s Kitchen) and Maysles Documentary Center (Harlem)

title: Fall for Dance Festival
description: Returning to City Center for its 21st season, this year’s festival features five genre-spanning programs, including A.I.M by Kyle Abraham, Complexions Contemporary Ballet, Dutch National Ballet, and more.
cost: $30 ($23 if you buy at the box office)

title: Free Outdoor Movies: The Breakfast Club
description: Enjoy a free outdoor screening of 'The Breakfast Club' at McGolrick Park (Greenpoint).

title: I'll Have... The Bisque! Comedy Variety Show for Charity
description: Improv troupe The Bisque and stand-up guests Pratima Mani and Maria Decotis team up for a comedy show to raise money for the Brigid Alliance, a nonprofit organization that supports people who must travel long distances for abortion care.

title: Punderdome: Comedy Pun Slam
description: Pun-masters have a war of the words at the beloved pun-slinging competition. Tonight's installment includes an all-star tournament of pun champions.

title: The Babadook 10th Anniversary Screenings with Jennifer Kent
description: Celebrate Jennifer Kent's 2014 psychological horror film 'The Babadook' with Kent in-person for Q&A following select screenings at various locations: Museum of the Moving Image, Rooftop Films, and IFC Center.
address: Museum of the Moving Image, Rooftop Films, IFC Center

title: Astronomy on Tap: Watching the Skies
description: An evening where astronomy enthusiasts come together in a bar to hear talks from professional scientists and play themed games. Tonight’s naked-eye astronomy edition includes guest speakers Shirin Gul Zaidi and Shawn Ray.

title: Brooklyn Books + Booze
description: Hear established and up-and-coming authors of different genres read from their current works every third Tuesday of the month. Tonight's edition features Rob Cameron, A.C. Wise, Ed Zuckerman, and Carlos Hernandez.
address: Barrow's Intense Tasting Room, Industry City

title: The Broad Squad
description: Kendra Cunningham curates this monthly throwback variety show filled with stand-up, storytelling, music, and tarot readings. Tonight features comedy by Mel Ferraro, Erin Anderson, Vicky Kuperman, Max Cohen, and Mindy Raf, storytelling by Sandi Marx, and music by Shawn Hollenbach.

title: Animation Nights New York
description: Watch animated short films and virtual reality animation experiences from around the world at this monthly curated screening event.
